title.narrative: Private sector involvement to Vietnam’s combat in Climate Change

description.narrative: The Embassy-CG acknowledges that government efforts are not sufficient to address climate change in Vietnam. The private sector involvement is needed to change the trends. Therefore EKN-CG would like to have a better insight in potential technical options that the local private sector can pick up and implement whether with support of the Dutch private sector and knowledge institutes. Given the cross-sectoral nature of climate change, it is critical to select to ensure a focused assignment. The overall objective is to identify low-hanging fruit and quick-win business opportunities in the selected sub-sectors that have a significant impact on climate mitigation, that improve quality of products and services and that make use of technological and digital innovations.Specific objectives:1. Based on insights in Vietnam’s GHG emissions identify and propose potential energy-using industrial or consumer practices / equipment / processes that could be easily substituted, retrofitted, transformed or upgraded to reduce emissions and save costs.2. Relate the abovementioned mitigation leads to business development for private sector technology providers.
Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of people directly reached - Total

comment.narrative: 15 Dutch and 200 Local, of which 115 Direct and 100 Indirect.

483 businesses were approached for the survey, including dozens FDI businesses, some of which Dutch. , due to low response only 34 in-depth interviews were held (mostly with multiple interviewees per interview), including 8 FDI businesses of which 5 were Dutch.

description.narrative: Business development, by investment or trade of local or Dutch companies with(in) low and middle income countries

title.narrative: Number of people indirectly reached - Total

comment.narrative: 483 businesses were approached for the survey, including dozens FDI businesses, some of which Dutch.

title.narrative: Number of identified opportunities for investment and/or follow-up PSD projects - Total

comment.narrative: 3-6 opportunities for investment identified and 1-2 follow up projects.

• Eight opportunities for further action were identified, of which five were prioritized. For those five, some (potential) project activities were suggested, i.e. activities with a “developmental” focus as well as a commercial focus.
